title: How to Screen Mirror on Roku: Easy Steps for Android, iPhone, PC, & Mac

steps.title: Connect your Roku and iOS device to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your Roku and iOS device to the same Wi-Fi network . This is how your Roku and iPhone or iPad will link together. You will need an iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch running iOS 12.3 or later to screen mirror to Roku. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center . If you're using an iPhone or iPad with Face ID, swipe down from the top-right corner of the Home screen. If your iOS device has Touch ID, swipe up from the bottom.

steps.title: Tap the Screen Mirroring icon.
steps.content: Tap the Screen Mirroring icon. This is the tile with two overlapping rectangles. A menu will expand with a list of available AirPlay-compatible devices. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select your Roku TV or streaming device.
steps.content: Select your Roku TV or streaming device. If you don't see your Roku, make sure it's turned on and connected to the same Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Enter the AirPlay passcode.
steps.content: Enter the AirPlay passcode. If prompted to enter an AirPlay passcode, enter the code shown on your TV into the prompt on your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: On your Roku, select Always allow.
steps.content: On your Roku, select Always allow . If you only want content from your device to be mirrored for the current section, select Allow instead. [3] X Research source Once you make your selection, your iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad's screen will now be mirrored to Roku. To stop screen mirroring, open the Control Center again and select Stop Screen Mirroring .

steps.title: Connect your Roku and Android to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your Roku and Android to the same Wi-Fi network. If your Android phone or tablet is a Samsung Galaxy model, you can use Samsung Smart View to mirror your screen to Roku. You must be using Android 10.0 or later to mirror your screen to Roku.

steps.title: Swipe down from the top of the home screen.
steps.content: Swipe down from the top of the home screen. This opens the Quick Panel. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Smart View.
steps.content: Tap Smart View . If you don't see this option, you may need to scroll down through the icon list. Your Samsung phone or tablet will now scan for available devices to mirror to.

steps.title: Select your Roku.
steps.content: Select your Roku. If your Roku doesn't appear in the list, make sure it's turned on and connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your phone or tablet. If a PIN appears on your TV screen, enter the PIN into the corresponding prompt on your Samsung device.

steps.title: Tap Start now on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Tap Start now on your phone or tablet. This connects your phone or tablet to your Roku.

steps.title: On your Roku, select Always allow.
steps.content: On your Roku, select Always allow . If you only want content from your device to be mirrored for the current section, select Allow instead. Once you make your selection, you'll see your phone or tablet's screen mirrored to your Roku. To stop screen mirroring, open the System menu and tap the Screen Mirroring icon again.

steps.title: Make sure your Android can screen mirror to Roku.
steps.content: Make sure your Android can screen mirror to Roku. To mirror your screen, you will need an Android that supports Miracastâ€”unfortunately, some Androids only support Chromecast. If you have a Google Pixel or Nexus, you cannot screen mirror to Roku. According to Roku, you can mirror most other Android screens to Roku as long as it's running Android 10.0 or later and supports screen mirroring. [5] X Research source To find out for your specific model, search the web for your model and "screen mirroring."

steps.title: Connect your Roku and Android to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your Roku and Android to the same Wi-Fi network. The devices must be on the same Wi-Fi network to use screen mirroring.

steps.title: Open your Android quick settings.
steps.content: Open your Android quick settings. You can do this on most devices by swiping down from the top of your home screen.

steps.title: Tap the Screen Mirroring option for your Android.
steps.content: Tap the Screen Mirroring option for your Android. The name of this option varies, as does its icon. You may need to swipe to the next page of apps to find it. Common names for screen mirroring on Android: Moto Connect Quick Connect Screen casting HTC Connect Screen mirroring SmartShare Smart View AllShare Cast Wireless Display Display mirroring Cast

steps.title: Select your Roku TV or streaming device.
steps.content: Select your Roku TV or streaming device. On some Androids, you may first need to select Miracast to see the list of available devices. [6] X Research source You may have to tap Start , Connect , or similar to connect.

steps.title: On your Roku, select Always allow.
steps.content: On your Roku, select Always allow . If you only want content from your device to be mirrored for the current section, select Allow instead. To stop screen sharing, reopen your quick settings and tap the screen mirroring option again.

steps.title: Connect your Roku and PC to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your Roku and PC to the same Wi-Fi network. If you're using a desktop or laptop computer running Windows 10 or Windows 11, it's easy to mirror your screen to a Roku TV or streaming device as long as they're on the same Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Press the Windows Key + K.
steps.content: Press the Windows Key + K . Pressing Windows key + K at the same time opens the Cast menu and begins to scan for available devices. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select your Roku TV or streaming device.
steps.content: Select your Roku TV or streaming device. As long as your Roku TV is turned on and connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your computer, you should see it as an option.

steps.title: On your Roku, select Always allow.
steps.content: On your Roku, select Always allow . If you only want content from your device to be mirrored for the current section, select Allow instead. Once selected, your computer's display will be mirrored to your Roku TV or streaming stick.

steps.title: Connect your Roku and Mac to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your Roku and Mac to the same Wi-Fi network. Because most Roku devices support AirPlay, mirroring your Mac's screen to a Roku TV or streaming device is easy if both devices are on the same Wi-Fi network. Your Mac must be running macOS Mojave 10.14.5 or later to mirror your screen to Roku. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Control Center icon on your Mac.
steps.content: Click the Control Center icon on your Mac. It's the icon with two sliders in the menu bar. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Screen Mirroring icon.
steps.content: Click the Screen Mirroring icon. It's the tile with two overlapping rectangles. Your Mac will now scan for devices to connect to.

steps.title: Select your Roku TV or streaming device.
steps.content: Select your Roku TV or streaming device. If this prompts you to enter a code, enter the 4-digit code that now appears on your TV screen.

steps.title: Choose the Mirror option.
steps.content: Choose the Mirror option. AirPlay will ask if you want to extend or mirror your screen. Choosing Mirror ensures that the entire display will be mirrored on your TV rather than a second desktop.

steps.title: On your Roku, select Always allow.
steps.content: On your Roku, select Always allow . Or, if you only want content from your device to be mirrored for the current section, select Allow instead. Once selected, your Mac's display will be mirrored to your Roku TV or streaming stick.

steps.title: Make sure Screen Mirroring is enabled on your Roku.
steps.content: Make sure Screen Mirroring is enabled on your Roku. It should be enabled by default, but there's a chance somebody accidentally turned it off. Here's where to look: Press the Home button on your Roku remote and select Settings . Select System . Select Screen Mirroring . Select Screen Mirroring Mode . If "Never allow" is selected, select Prompt (to be prompted each time a device tries to connect) or Always allow to allow all devices to cast to your Roku.

steps.title: Confirm that your Roku is connected to the right network.
steps.content: Confirm that your Roku is connected to the right network. If your Roku is connected to a different network than your phone, tablet, or computer, you won't be able to mirror your screen. To check: Press Home on your Roku remote and select Settings . Go to Network > About . Find the network name at the top of the list and make sure it's the same as your phone, tablet, or computer. Make sure your phone, tablet, or computer is connected to Wi-Fi, not cellular.

steps.title: Make sure your Roku supports AirPlay 2 (iOS/Mac).
steps.content: Make sure your Roku supports AirPlay 2 (iOS/Mac). Most Roku models support AirPlay 2, including nearly all modern Roku TVs, 4K Roku devices, Roku Ultra, Roku Streambar, Roku Streaming Stick+, and Roku Premiere. If you have an older model running Roku OS 9.3 or earlier, you cannot mirror your iPhone, iPad, or Mac's screen to your Roku. Here's how to check: Press Home on your Roku remote and select Settings . Select System > About . Press the Right arrow on the remote. As long as the "Software version" is 9.4 or later, the device should support AirPlay 2. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure AirPlay hasn't been turned off (iOS/Mac).
steps.content: Make sure AirPlay hasn't been turned off (iOS/Mac). AirPlay is enabled by default, so this usually won't be an issue. However, if your Roku device still won't show up when you try to mirror your screen, here's how to check: Press Home on your Roku remote and select Settings . Select Apple AirPlay and HomeKit . If "AirPlay" is set to Off, select On . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on Fast Start on your Roku TV.
steps.content: Turn on Fast Start on your Roku TV. If you have a Roku TV, keep Fast Start active so your TV stays online when powered off. Otherwise, you may not see your Roku TV as an option when you want to mirror your screen. Press Home on your Roku remote and select Settings . Go to System > Power . Select Fast TV start . Select Enable Fast TV Start .
